text: Great breakfast and service in the non-smoking dining room. Had the Ham and Cheese omelette with English muffin toast. Amelia had 3 eggs over easy with rye toast (very good). Would repeat at RePete's.

Really, really good food in copious quantities. Quite a surprise to find, but the other reviews are right - RePetes will delight! The ambience is a bit strange for those unused to Vegas' combined gambling + (insert business type of choice), but the separate dining room is a nice place to enjoy a savory meal. The calamari was great, the crab cakes were fantastic, the chicken cordon blue was delectable, the oso bucco was delicious, and the bananas foster cheesecake was a dream. We'll definitely be back for more!

The only reason i give this place 4 starts instead of five was due to the fact that we waited 30-40 mins for our check after we were done eating. The food was excellent and the room away from the bar was clean, but the server was all by herself and had a six top, two top and three-four tops and since we were done eating, it felt like we didnt matter when we were ready to leave.

We have been to this place twice now and keep getting more and more impressed. The food is great and so is the service. Seth and Linda are awesome and very attentive. This might just be our new bar. I can't wait until we go back again.
Good food.  Good service.  Great atmosphere.   Lots of TVs.   Nice place away from the main strip.

May look like a bar but far from it when it comes to the food. Your missing out if you pass on this. Just off the strip on the south side one block up. Prices are LOW for the service and quality of food at this little gem.
This restaurant had a wide variety of foods on their menu and they were all delicious. Our waitress had a little difficulty with the drinks, but all of the food came out right. It was very tasty.

Surprisingly good!  Totally not the bar food or IHOP style breakfast I was bracing myself for.  I had the breakfast burrito and it was hearty & flavorful.  My husband got the hash and it was completely delicious!  

If you're looking for a good place that's reasonably priced to watch a game, or an alternative to a crappy Denny's or IHOP - definitely check out RePete's.

Yesterday I had some friends in town that were leaving on an early flight so I figured we get breakfast @5:30am. Well not being able to get into Whinchell's because the door was locked and they did answer the buzzer, we went up the road to Re-Pete's.
The bartender makes a pretty good bloody Mary and the  breakfast was surprisingly good. Since I work in the area I will now go to Re-Pete's instead of Whinchell's.

I travel through Las Vegas airport alot and i always come here with coworkers inbound and outbound. I love the breakfast food here and the lunch menu is pretty good too. We will continue coming here as long as i am in Vegas

Food was good and cheap during happy hour, but I think I got ripped off on my wine.  I'll have to ask next timeexactly what I'm paying for.

Too bad happy hour ends at 6, or I would go there more often.  EXTEND IT TO 7pm PLEASE - you'll get more customers!

AND -  their "marketing guy" George needs to be fired.  I asked him to call me so I could set something up for a football gathering, and he never called me.  My friend has also been calling to set up a Super Bowl Sunday get-together, and he can't get George to call him back either,  Lot's of money being lost!!!
Awesome food.  Steak tips was great, get the Au Poivre sauce!  Great compliment to the steak.

So we come to Vegas every so often and was looking for a non-chain off strip not to pay more than its worth kinda place and we stumbled on REPETES with noted positive reviews (yes they deserve 5 stars damnit!) Ordered the French onion soup, very tasty! Two words - Beef Tips, people! The red skinned whipped potatoes are to die for, but wait it gets better! This is where things get x rated. The Au Poivre sauce is orgasmic! After tasting this sauce I was ready to take the chef home with me! Seriously people! Highly recommend when in Vegas!!

Comfortable atmosphere and excellent service.  Definitely not bar food like we were expecting.  What we got was a meal we would have expected from a fancy restaurant. We didn't discover this place until our last day in town but we will definitely eat here more often during our next visit.

Crappiest service I have ever exoerienced. I have no idea what a gamer needs to do here to get a drink. The tenders seem to like to hover at the south end of the bar, they keep taking my glass and never come back with a new drink. But if you sit at the bar not playing and taking up space, you get a ton of attention!
Oh man!!!  Repetes is closing soon!!  Wtf!!  The owners sold it and their going to be some changes.  Hopefully they won't change the bar food.
I'm sitting hear at the bar and i cant get the bartenders attention. She's to busy talking to a liquored up patron. So I'm out and wont be back.  Kinda annoying.
Roasted Veggie Salad.. Yum!!!So glad I stumbled in here.The staff was very friendly.Our server Christine was very sweet and had some great menu suggestions.I will definitely be back!!!

Repetes just opened 4/9/12 in the old Screwballs location. The inside has been totally redone and it has a small enclosed dining room as well as the bar area. The food is excellent. The owners have been in the restaurant business for many years in Las Vegas/Henderson and are well known for using nothing but the best ingredients and presentation, having attentive and friendly employees and always seem to be around to ensure that everything runs smoothly. The sold their last restaurant to a casino years ago and have just gotten back in the business with Repetes.
The menu is limited, compared to other competitor restaurants, but the attention to quality shows. They grind their own meat for the hamburgers, they bake their own turkey for their turkey  pannini and other turkey dishes. The greek starters are to die for. You have to try the calamari fries !!!!! The greek meatballs are tender tender tender. Hamburgers put everyones elses to shame. Sliders ??? Three different kinds. Tomato bisque ????? Our table ordered one and after tasting it we had to order three more. No frozen french fries here....fresh and perfectly cooked.
The bar area is very nice and they have plenty of different beers on tap. If you are looking for a quick lunch or a nice dinner this is the place to go. The dining room is very well done, quiet, and you can watch the bar area from there. If you want a family dinner, a place to take a date, or just something a little more quiet....this is a really nice place.
This is sure to be a hit with the locals. This is within walking distance of the outlet mall on South Las Vegas Blvd and several of the large time share units. If you want a nice place to eat at a moderate price.....try Repetes you wont be sorry.

Great place to watch football, food is good with football specials ranging from $5-$7. Sometimes service is slow if it gets busy but they are always friendly. 

Plenty of flat screens for watching sports. Nice decor too. 

Con: I really want to teach them how to pour a Guiness properly.
First visit yesterday, had breakfast which was awesome.  The waitress, Elicia was terrific, friendly and offered great suggestions for our meal.  Looking forward to going back and trying dinner.
Great food and even better jokes (supplied by Pete).

I met some of my gf's there after I got off of my swing shift a few nights ago. It was my first time there, it was pretty late, but the bartender Josh (Joshy:)) was so great!! My BJ machine started portraying erratic behavior and he was quick to respond and solve my problem with a "IT Tech" guy. He was also nice. He calibrated it and afterwards, it worked like a charm! I will def be back soon!!
Great bar, awesome beer options, food is great and now they are HOME OF THE PHILADELPHIA EAGLES!!

Food, fast service, and ambiance all 5 stars. 

We got seated fast. Of course because there wasn't too much people. It's a bar but there's a sectioned off place for just food.  When we went there was only one waitress, ALWAYS checking up on us and everything came out pretty fast.  She was very friendly. 

Food was just delishh. I had the steak pita which just melted in my mouth. I know good steak and that was GOOOOD. 

Coming back here for sure!

Filet Mingon tips! So delicious. Their peppercorn sauce too...omg. We tried out this bar next to our house because we needed a change in scenary from our other bars. Plus, someone told me that it was an Eagles bar..which is one..but no longer is that the case. :/ They stopped being an Eagles bar like 2 weeks before I showed up..of course !

However, the food is great! Not your ordinary bar food for sure. They also do some cool games during football season. We won money on the square games. 

The staff is awesome. I think one bartender is named DJ or some two letter name and he is very nice and a good bartender. The people skills do matter in that industry! I forget the girls name, but she is nice too. They are usually bartending together when we go. 

The owner walks around occasionally and he is very friendly too. 

Good bar, good people. Check it out.

Repete's  is a truly extraordinary restaurant and bar. Without question, this family owned establishment offers one of the most comprehensive and creative menus in Las Vegas. Chef Thierry is unrivaled in his passion for preparing every dish to perfection. The wait and bar staff are incredibly professional, courteous, and friendly. Kudos to owners Pete and Jerry for their hard work in making this such a
 wonderful restaurant and bar. The Best Bar Food in Nevada!
Excellent Greek inspired menu.  Happy hour 3-6pm.
Two days in a row....need I say more? Friendly staff and amazing food! Steak with bleu cheese and bacon topping, black and bleu burger, garlic chicken pizza. ..we'll be back!!

We stopped in for a quick lunch on our way to shopping. The Yelp reviews really did this place justice. My wife had the beef tips and they were phenomenal.  I had a bacon burger which was one of the best hamburgers I have eaten in the last 10 years. 

I highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a good off the strip place to eat in a nice casual and clean environment.   The wait staff were very, very helpful and we can't wait to come back here again!

A great place 24/7.  Owners were the former owners of The Greens Supper Club before a casino company bought that restaurant.  Breakfasts here are wonderful and won't break the budget.  Everything on the menu is home made-- breakfast fried potatoes are handmade and excellent.  For lunch or dinner, lots of choices-- everything from some Greek food to burgers to pizzas to full meals.  Two rooms for seating-- the bar can be a bit loud at times; the dining room is quieter and more comfortable.  Would highly recommend this restaurant.

Finally got a chance to explore Repete's last night. Didn't try any food, simply got a few beers and played some poker on the machines. 

I have to say I'm on the fence about it for two reasons. One the beer prices are a bit higher than what I expected since its a local's type of place. The second reason being that both my friend and I were gambling and they don't comp. drinks for players. 

The HUGE plus side was the bartenders, they were amazing,  attentive, and actually joked and kept a conversation going.

One of our favorite 24hr spots. All food is good and service is awesome too. A hint of Greek on the menu which is cool. Fish tacos, Greek meatballs and grape leaves, and lettuce cups are all some of our favs

Holy AMAZEBALLS!! We came here after reading the fantastic yelp reviews. We have driven by so many times but never thought to come in. My oh my we were SO impressed by the place.

When we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised by the clean surroundings and beautiful decor. It didn't wreak of smoke, which we had assumed by its outside appearance. Once seated, the server greeted us and was very friendly and hospitable. 

Now the food! EXCELLENT! Husband got the wedge salad and it was to die for. Their blue cheese dressing is homemade and you can taste that right away. The rest of our dishes were exquisitely presented and were absolutely delicious. Upon finishing our meal, we found out that the chef is a "classically trained chef from France."
Wow! We would never have expected this neighborhood bar to be such a fine dining experience (great prices though).

Love RePetes!!

Service was great.  Food was tasty.  Value plus nice decor and clean restaurant made this restaurant a 10 in my eyes for  diner/cafe/bar feel.  Our waitress was amazing and exceeded expectations.   Definitely coming back on my next trip to Vegas!
Excellent food.  Steak Tips, wings, Cuban sandwich, French onion soup all excellent. Don't get anything with tomato sauce. Greeks own it not Italians. Excellent servers!!

My favorite local bar! Staff is amazing & drinks are always great. Some of the best pizza in town honestly. Always tastes fresh too! Come here often after work with coworkers & they always treat us great!

Hey....stopped in yesterday to meet up with a buddy who lives in Hooterville (Henderson). This place in half way for both of us. Absolutely awesome/fun place. Greeted as soon as I walked in. Had several beers poured by the fabulous 'Jana'. I hope I got that right as I'm terrible with names. Had a beer called 'Devistator'. Dark, kinda sweet but not heavy. Excellent. It's a double Bock made in Utah. They have a great variety of draft beer but I stuck with this one for the afternoon. Tried one of the daily specials...Chowder and chicken cordon blu. (sp)sandwich. Fantastic. My buddy had the Swiss mushroom burger/fries. Raved about it. Seriously the service food and friendly atmosphere made it a fun afternoon out. Give it a try you will not be disappointed. BTW they have a very nice dining room for those that bring children or do not want to particapate in the bar scene. TTFN

Came here on a Sunday morning around lunch time. Perfect place to grab a drink and a quick bite while watching a football game. I had a Bloody Mary and it was pretty good. 

For food I got the nachos and my stepdad got the battered fish tacos. The nachos were good and I was a big fan on the cheese sauce. I do however wish they had real pico de gallo instead of just diced tomatoes. The taco place came with 3 tacos and my step dad said they were pretty good and filling. 

I'll definitely be stopping by the next time I want to eat somewhere close to the strip but away from the hustle and bustle.

For what this restaurant is, it is a five star all of the way! I found the flavors in the goat cheese and spinach pizza to be far beyond this restaurants price point. The goat cheese had a fantastic bitter quality to it and the spinach was fresh and cooked to perfection! You could even taste the quality of the olive oil and garlic used. Far better food, atmosphere, and service than I expected for a bar. I'm blown away

We arrived in town and was very hungry so we did the yelp and found this place. I will say they hands down are really good to their customers so based in that it's 5 stars. Prices were decent, good was ok. Yelp had my expectations high so a bit of a let down. Place is very clean

Very nice and clean inside. Plenty of bar counter space. The wings are great and the beer mugs are extra cold which I like. Bartenders are only so-so if you're not a regular. Seems like they are extremely nice and love spending the majority of the time focusing on the regulars. I Will never make this my main spot, but will definitely come back when looking for a change in atmosphere.

Looks like a roadside bar from the outside...and that's what it is!  Stopped by here  on the way to the rental car station on S. Las Vegas Blvd.  Gotta say that the breakfast was solid. And what a bargain. Excellent, friendly service from Linda behind the bar.   Great corned beef hash with well-prepared eggs and hash browns.    I love diner food after a night on the town, but this place was NOT diner greasy.  Sure it's not Bouchon, but if u want a traditional American breakfast, you can't go wrong with this place!

Good food and friendly service.  This place is a notch above some of the other local gaming pubs in my opinion.  The food was definitely better, gastro-pub'ish instead of the nachos and burgers stuff.  I also thought the beer options were strong on tap and in bottle. 
The place was upscale, not all that crowded the night I went and had a friendly cozy clean atmosphere.  Not much smoke either but it is allowed.

Gaming wise- I found the worst blackjack game machine available and gave up after ten bad hands but I got a good beer comp'd for my down luck.

Id definitely return to this place if in the area, loved the burger and another table had some fish and chips that looked especially nice .. and filling.
Had their breakfast burrito after a 3 hour flight and a missed breakfast.  Would def come again. Service is really friendly and the food is great.

Tried the special Cajun Shrimp, Shrimp Saffron pasta, and Monte Cristo in our party.  Everything was fresh and delicious!  We enjoyed the variety offered that satisfied what each of us was looking for.  We also enjoyed the Creme Brûlée as recommended by other reviewers.  The Creme Brûlée was very light and the perfect end to a great tasting meal!

Came in for a qu I'm lunch after leaving airport. Great food! Great service! Summer is a wonderful server. The owner, Pete is also a peach. Very sweet, kind man. I had a house salad and buffalo wings, which were both flavorful and fresh.

Review based on overall experience.
Average looking bar inside, staff kind off to busy at times, games where good winning ones not take it all, for this being a bar they went with more expensive food so if wanting simple not for you, a little more money here, and for heaven sake who ever was playing a guitar and singing was so horrible That's only reason I left awwwwww horrible.
But I would go back here as long as that guitar guy is not there. Same goes for the people I was with, they wanted out asap, lol
Very good food! I had the gyro lunch special and it was so tasty and hot. The service was quick and the server was nice. Would definitely come here again. Only problem was smokers at the next table.

The food here is delicious.  The beef tips melt in your mouth. The red skin potatoes are firm and fresh. The vegetables have a nice amount of garlic and flavor to them and are crisp. The bartender is very nice and sweet. She has great customer service and was very attentive.  Great place

I am a Las Vegas local for 7 years now. I have some feedback for your bar/grill. I went to RePete's for the first time toward the end of March. Based on my neighbors recommendation, I had high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised! It was very nice inside and noticeably newly remodeled. The staff was very friendly. This was a Sunday right around noon. I came a few other nights, on Tuesday and Thursdays, to meet up with my neighbors who come there often. The bartender, JC, was very friendly and accommodating. I usually put in $100 per trip to play video poker which end up being about 3 times per week. However, Saturday, May 17th around 8pm-10pm, I had a different experience. First off, I was not greeted promptly or very warmly. I wasn't offered a menu. I then put in $20 and ended up hitting a four of a kind. I played for a while and when I needed to get back home, the waitress charged me for one of my two glasses of wine. I find this not the usual "culture" of gambling in Las Vegas. As a frequent video poker player, I tend to lose more money than I gain in general. I feel unjustly charged for a glass of wine as I have in the past put in larger quantities of money and lost a lot more. I have heard other patrons with this sentiment as well.

I was hoping to find a neighborhood bar to frequent quite often, but I was very turned off by my last experience. I will continue to play my money elsewhere as will my husband.

Perhaps, if that is your policy, it should be communicated to the patrons. I would have at least had a choice as to buying a glass of wine, leaving or putting in another $20. I felt very uncomfortable with being handed a bill as I expected to get up and go. It was quite embarrassing to me.

Thank you for your consideration.
Just great food.   Difficult to go  wrong.   They give their food lot of thought when prepared and it shows.  Great friendly service5
Food was decent enough.  Draft beer was weak sauce.  Place is smokey to the third power.

GREAT place for lunch! Highly recommended.

South of the strip (and a couple blocks west).  

Amazing hand cut fries matched by burger that is ground on site each morning. Top things off with some great craft beers on tap (shhh!) and it all adds up to a great place for lunch.

Clean but fairly empty (I had a later lunch, starting at 1pm), I was served quickly and ably. 
The offer for 15% off for checking in on Yelp was honored with a smile.

Food was good talked to bar tender about jerseys hanging in bar,  told her they were fake and asked how could you use fake nfl jerseys in your bar for a giveaway ???  Played stupid and thought I was dumb for asking if they have fake jerseys what else isn't real?  Take your money and go somewhere legit
Let them know it's not alright!!!!!

This place is great!!  When we first walked up, we thought it looked like just another bar. But inside, they do have a seperate, non-smoking dinning room, which we loved. It was seperated by a glass wall so we still felt like we were part of the bar but with out all the smoke and noise. Food was top notch, Completely not expteced form a "bar" type restraunt. The martini's were fab too. Gotta try pineapple cake martini!!!  Service was awesome too. My friend is VERY picky, and server was more than accomadating and even had her food re-cooked with out a problem.

My husband and I finally got a night out without the kids. Instead of going to a fancy restaurant we heard the food was great at RePete's. We were not disappointed! My hubby is hard to please, but after eating the Beef Tips he was sold. I've been craving them ever since. Can't wait to try some of the Greek food. Our server was very friendly. Oh I also won $40. Great experience overall.

A little bit of a wait but he food was delicious. The Meat Lovers Omelet with a side of feta cheese. The flavor was amazing. Don't be fools by the outside or the barrish ambiance. This place serves a great breakfast!

Stopped by for breakfast and WOW! Excellent breakfast and fabulous wait staff and very reasonable prices! Its a short walk from Tahiti Village and worth the few extra steps. This will be our new go to breakfast place while in town. We will be back later this week to try out the happy hour!
Great spot to watch a game.  Not your average bar food.  I had the fish tacos and they were top 5 I've ever had.  Salmon is also amazing.  The staff is super nice and welcoming.
Gotta say.. this bars food is amazing. I love the pizza , the crust is just awesome. I've tried alot of the food and nothing has disappointed me. Ever. Visit this local bar
First time here, had the Black and Blue sliders, and they were excellent. Tried the veggie pizza and the dough taste like pizza dough should taste.

Just had a ICE COLD BUD. And the linguini with clams was GREAT.
Staff was very friendly.
Highly recommend this place especially if you are done with the normal bar bulls**t.

One of my favorite bars around here repeats is right near the corner of warm springs in Las Vegas Boulevard. The parking is on Warm Springs and there's normally plenty of parking so that's smooth. The servers here are good and the food here is excellent so this place definitely gets 5 stars but it's not the cheapest place in town. I guess when you get excellent quality you also don't get excellent prices but the owner is very kind and generous with his time and makes sure everything is running up to his standards which are obviously excellent standards. You can try any food anytime of the day breakfast lunch or dinner I've had the breakfast all sorts of different types of breakfast and they're all excellent. The other thing that I really enjoyed getting is the turkey dinner kind of like a Thanksgiving style dinner. I don't always feel like getting a Thanksgiving style dinner but when I do its just fantastic!

First time here, remember when it was screwballs. Nicely redone and open floor space. The bartenders were very attentive and recommended two of the three dishes we ordered. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. Looking forward to a return visit.

Formally trained chef shows in the food offered and the great flavor when eaten.  So many choices. Love this place.  Must admit I was surprised......expected bar food but it's so much more.  The Greek custard pastry for dessert was to die for.  Exceptional attention by the servers.
Their Goat Cheese and Spinach Pizza is to die for!   Great food, hands down---especially during Happy Hour :)

Nice hidden jewel.  Looks like s local spot.  Lots of tv's and moderate music volume to conversation is easy.  Staff was attentive and food was good.  I had the daily special tomato soup and sandwich ....I thought it would be s 1/2 sandwich but it was a whole!  My husband had the killer burger and fries...cooked perfectly.  Not far from the oasis RV park which we frequent.  We will be back!
Food is awesome! Service was great! My kids cleared their plates and my husband even licked his! Christy is an awesome waitress!! Full menu available 24/7!!

I seriously love this place.  The food is awesome and the price is reasonable.  Never too busy and not too smokey.  Maria and Josh are awesome and are half the reason you should visit this place.  That being said this place would get my fifth star if JC wasn't the random variable in having a perfect experience here.  His service is sub par and he has done a handful of things that make it a disappointment to visit when he's on duty.  Even when I bring friends in for a single visit they are like "wtf is with this dude?".  Other than that I love this place and for now will just have to time my visits accordingly.  Hopefully the owners/management catch on.

Two things: Beef Tips or Chicken Picata. I hear everything else is pretty good too. It is a bar which is why I don't visit more often. Everyone I have taken with me loves the food as well. The service is great also. Support local business and try the beef tips! MMMMMmmmmm
So easy to get to service is the best and can't beat the happy hour .

$5 martinis for happy hour. I loved the key lime. Goat cheese spinach pizza is crave worthy. We had the chicken lettuce wraps and zucchini sticks. The food is delicious. Fresh drinks and nice atmosphere.

We will be back!!!! Made cosmopolitan exactly how I like it... Food was great!!
Wing dings, scampi, Caesar salad with spicy fingers... So yummy!!!
Good gaming, great food, love pork chops & eggs and the pork osso bucco. Nice to see JC back!

Love this place!!! Owners are really nice people great food, great bartenders and good gaming!!! Lots of screens with sports on all the time!!! Daytime bartenders are the best. Very friendly and attentive.

Came here on a recommendation that the food was awesome here. The beer on tap was just a plus. I got a burger and a beer here. Food was good. Beer was okay. But the thing that had got me was the service. Maybe it was the time that I came in and don't get me wrong, the people working were definitely friendly but just not around when we needed something.  It was fairly busy around the bar but empty in the table area and people gradually left when eventually no one was in the bar. But  no one really came around to fill up our water or get another beer and whenever I tried waving someone down they would be to busy rushing back and forth between an area. 

Probably just a fluke but I do give it 4 stars and  I do recommend trying it.

I'm surprised I finally met one of the worst bartenders in Las Vegas.

I used to come here quite often during grave-shift about a year ago. Today I was driving past with a friend and decided to stop in for some food at about 4pm.

Elisha took our order (Breakfast Burger, Medium Rare, Fries - and Chicken Strips, Ranch, BBQ and Fries).
She took 3 steps from us to the computer - and had to ask what we wanted again. Then turned and asked us about fries - again. No big deal, better she verifies and has our order correctly, right?

The other Bartender (JC? I think was his name) came out with some Chicken Wings and Chips/Salsa. We let him know that was not our order and it must be for another guest. Elisha storms over and says to me "That is what you ordered." I said "I asked for a Breakfast Burger."  Elisha replies (in a condescending and bitchy tone) "No, you ordered Chips and Salsa with Sour cream on the side. Thats what you ordered."
JT just takes the food in back and lets us know not to worry about it and our food will be right up.
Sure enough - 1 min. later, JC has our actual order - which was being cooked.
Elisha came back to let us know that the food that she said "we ordered" was actually for a table and they had been at the bar before. - Okay cool - but you don't remember peoples faces? You don't remember that we walked in to a completely empty side of the bar? Most importantly - you don't remember the order you confirmed with us 3 times?

Food was good - as always. RePete's food is awesome. I am fairly certain Elisha put my burger in as "Well Done" rather than the "Med. Rare" I asked for - as the burger came out "Well Done" and the cooks here are normally very good about getting the right burger temp.

Elisha never asked us how the food was or checked in again. We finished eating and asked for our check.

This is where it get's kind of weird....
I place my credit card on the tab - now over the next 20 mins, she walks past slowly (probably 5 or 6 times) - looking directly at my card - but doesn't run it.

Again, JC save's the day and closes us out.

JC was hustling around the bar, I actually counted him serving 8 guests, before Elisha served 1 guest.

I also talked to one of the regulars that is often there at that time - she confirmed that Elisha is always terrible.

Both myself and my friend are bartenders here in Las Vegas - my friend being at a local bar in the same area, myself on the strip. Never have I ever seen one HORRIBLE  bartender (Elisha) drag such a great place down. Kudos to JC for carrying her every shift and having to deal with Elisha pissing people off (and having to split tips with him).

Also - I only know Elisha's name from the receipt - she never gave us her name. 

If management actually reads this - contact me.

RePete's is a big improvement to that enjoyable dump that was there before, a fan of both establishments :D  I've been here a few times for late night/early morning eating and once for that game 7 of the NBA final BOO HEAT BOO!!! haha 

Last time I've checked their Happy Hour was 1/2 pizzas and apps Mondays-Fridays 3pm to 6 pm and midnight to 3am.  And their beers were reasonably prices with a decent selection of craft brews.

If Buffalo Wild Wing, Outback Steakhouse, or any of the other alcohol/food selling businesses are busy and you need a place to go RePete's is just as spacy, not as crammed, and has a better tasting food menu.  I am a fan of their menu though I haven't had everything yet.  It's mostly better than your typical bar food and includes calamari fries which were pretty big pieces, greek meatballs which I was told was their patrons favorites they were OK , nachos which were pretty huge, various pizzas so far all delicious, monte cristo and other sandwiches, salmons and steaks, pasta, etc. 

I've only had one horrible experience with them and that was when they had the hardest time splitting checks and adjusting the prices on the bill when it switched from happy hour prices  to regular prices.  Other then that most of the customer service has been good.

They have plenty of tables and TVs and are well maintained.  Great place to hang out  enjoy a few brews close to the strip or to wait while the females shop.

Food was good but a bit pricey as other "bars" go.  Would actually classify this as a bit more upscale than your regular neighborhood bar.
Bartenders were a bit slow-but when they got you the service was good.
This is based on sitting at the bar-and I'll have to come back for actually dinner as the dining room was filled-so good sign.
Pete is an well trusted owner who has been known to always put out good food (The Greens in Green Valley)-so I'll be back.
Always great food! Friendly staff. I recommend the blackened chicken salad or the top sirloin.

If you want a great meal with excellent service this is place... Are used to go to the original Pete's on Boulder Highway... Then the greens... This place is by far my favorite... If you ask they will make anything for you.... My favorites Brick Chicken, Corned beef  Hash.... I live in LA and stop this place on my way out of town.... Try this place...

This place opened years ago under a different name and owners.  It was pretty much a "working man's" bar - Decent food with reasonable prices, attentive staff and a good time was had by everybody  When the new owners took over, it appears as  though they no longer wanted to be associated with the former clientele.  The remodeling was done in a very tasteful manner, but as the prices went up, the quality and quantity of the food went down - right along with the general attitudes of the hired help.  You would think that this bar was located somewhere on the Center Strip and didn't worry about *repete* business.   It seems that unless you are a big tipping regular, - or a well-endowed lady - you can pretty much expect to be ignored.  About a dozen co-workers (on Friday nights, there might be 30 or 40 of us) and myself used to visit the "old" bar on a regular basis, but after being both ignored and price-gouged one too many times, none of us have been back for months.
Definitely a nice break from the strip and our server was very sweet.

I've been here twice.  The food is not the issue.  The machines are super tight and the service is not very attentive.  And then after you've dumped your dough into video poker, they hit you with a bill for all your drinks!  YAY!
Went there during the week at 7ish, nice waitress food is solid, If you don't feel like heading down the street to the strip then this place is a good choice.

Had a long trip in from California and originally went to CPK but they were too busy. Started looking on yelp and I found this nice stand alone place. Big tv's, 80's rock playing, and friendly service. Its away from the packed strip, easy to find, and the quality is there. I had their pepperoni pizza. Just the right amount of sauce and cheese. It can out hot and quick. I'm glad I found place, they will be on my list for my next trip to sin city.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place earlier...  this has become a regular place for me to eat when in Las Vegas.

This place doesn't look like much on the outside, and we only found it because of the great Yelp reviews.  There is a bar with electronic poker machines, etc. -- but we didn't even go in there.  We ate dinner in the separate smoke-free dining froom.

This is basically a very high quality mom & pop restaurant, frequented mostly by locals.  "Mom" has always been there whenever we have come in.  The menu is diverse and the food is just a great.  This is not "diner" food, but food that someone takes pride in making.  I love the house salad (it's hard to make stand out salad, but this one does) and the filet mignon tips.  Awesome.

The staff is very friendly and accomodating -- there is just nothing not to like about this place.  Love it.

I went here last night and had a decent meal for two people around 30 dollars. This includes two beers, a pizza, and some onion rings. The food was delicious. Our waiter didn't know the daily special when we asked, so she walked away to go find out mid sentence. It was kind of a weird transition. Regardless, it was nothing spectacular, but not horrible. I'd go back and try something else later I suppose. It kind if blends in with pts.

This is a cool bar, the service is almost always top notch - the prices are a little rough if you don't find them during happy hour.

All in all it's a good bar with good food, people, atmosphere and televisions.

Wow! What a nice find! Sorta out of the way. But really happy I tried it! Service was good! Food was great! I had the bacon cheeseburger and my friend had the patty melt. We were both very happy!!! Will definitely be back!!!!

If you haven't stopped into this joint yet, you have to give it a shot. It used to be Screwballs, which was a ratty dive, but the new owner has completely renovated the property. It now has a small restaurant seating area, large open bar area with table seating as well and TV's everywhere. The menu is very nice and while I haven't tried a lot of their items, they have a good selection of food, they have awesome burgers! Their Sausage over Penne Pasta was also great.  The staff there is also very friendly and they're open 24 hrs. .

My friend Loren and I needed some girl time. After about 2 days of deciding, we finally chose this spot since it was on our way home from work. It's your typical bar with another section designated for non smoking diners. We decided to sit on that side since it was much more quiet and we wanted to catch up over food and drinks. 

My friend orders a screwdriver, which you can't really mess up. I order a vodka (Tito's) and water with lime. I get my drink and it had a lemon instead. No biggie. I take a sip, it's ALL water. I let my friend taste it to make sure I wasn't just being a raging alcoholic since I'm used to stronger drinks. She agreed that it had almost no alcohol. Our waitress was super sweet and had the bartender add more Tito's. 

We order our food and I opt for the fish and chips with coleslaw. My friend had the salmon, which she said was good. Mine on the other hand was just eh. The fish had good texture and was moist but the breading just came right off. It was so much breading too that I just ended up with a thin strip of fish. The French fries were undercooked and soggy. The coleslaw was soggy from the beginning, probably because  it was pre-made and had way too much mayo. For dessert, we opted for bread pudding with caramel sauce. This was delicious. It was soft, but not too soggy and wet. And the caramel sauce added just the right amount of sweetness. 

The owner came around a few times to make sure that everything was well. He was this sweet older man and I appreciated the gesture. Our waitress was sweet as well, always coming by to check on us. You could tell this is a favorite spot for locals because the employees knew a lot of customers' names when they walked in. I had a good time here, but Id probably only come here if this was someone else's choice.
Went here yesterday and has a delicious burger, but was also greeted by the owner (I'm guessing). Super busy place with a great atmosphere.

So I came here for the first time on 12/10/13 and instantly made this my new favorite bar. Didn't hurt that video poker was kind to me. I tried their chicken wings which were good. Good sign. I ended up going back later that night and had dinner there. The bartender recommend the New York steak with the mashed potatoes and the sauce they make there. I can't remember what the name of the sauce was but it was delicious. The steak was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were good also. I am going to go back and try the burger soon. This is my new home. Going to walk here once it stops being so cold. Lol.

The best value in Las Vegas for happy hour. The pizza and chicken wings were excellent and half price between 3 to 6. If you want to stop by for food food and a beer this is the place!  The service is excellent. Our waitress was super friendly and quick!

I absolutely love it here! My friends took me here for the first time and I wasn't so interested because it just seemed like a lonely, random building. Little did I know it would be our favorite late night, after hours spot. What sold me was the bartender Josh! He is by far the best out there! He's so friendly, helpful and funny-basically just good vibes all around. On the nights that we came here already a bit tipsy, Josh didn't act like the other bartenders who are annoyed and roll their eyes at the drunk customers. (I know that sounds totally weird and we're not obnoxious drinkers lol) By now he usually knows what we like to drink and it's actually really cool knowing your bartender-win win for everyone. We usually order some kind of pizza, which is good, and I've had a few of their pasta dishes which are also really tasty! I've always had a good experience here and it's worth a try!

I have mixed feelings about this place, which I've been to many times since they opened. 

The food is great, good portions, fair prices, all house made. But this is Las Vegas. I've lived her 25 years and played video poker everywhere. Today was the first time I was denied one free glass of wine after putting $20 into a machine. It's the industry standard that if you put inat least $20 you get a free drink. I ordered an appetizer and 2 wines, nether of which was comped.

I asked Alicia? the bartender why, and she said it's because I didn't bet max on all my machine plays. ??? Who cares? I still put in $20. This was a first time this happened to me ever in Las Vegas.

I won't be playing there ever again, but might still stop in for a meal. They do have a separate non-smokers dining room, which I recommend.

Had a really good casual meal here just before heading to the airport for our flight home.  We had beef tips and a Swiss mushroom burger, served by a nice server named Naomi.  Our dishes were both very nicely cooked and tasty!  This is a nice place to eat before catching a flight; not too far from the rental car center and there's a gas station nearby the restaurant to top off the rental before dropping it off!  Very convenient!  We'll come back again!
Have had almost everything non the menu. I love it all. I'm a HUGE pub food fan at I'm never let down. The entrees are amazing. Def try the beef tips.
Who would think that a local bar would have a professional French chef cooking. They serve real dinners not just bar food. The dinners are delicious; so glad I found this place.

What greatplace, for the locals and inviting and kind to the out of town traveler. 

Ive lost count of the number of times i have been here,  but each tie it is fantastic. Broad menu and well made at a FAIR price. 

Thefrnched lamb chops are a DON'T MISS.
Had our company Holiday Party and the food and service was outstanding!!!!  This is going to be a favorite spot.

Repetes has some of the best bar food I've had in town. The nachos were gigantic!!! Full of toppings too. And the herds is a cheese sauce instead of shredded cheese they toss under a broiler. I hate when they do that. Hesse Saussure is the way to go!! Toppings galore as well. Ok now I want some nachos from repetes!! The meatballs are tasty but I wish they gave more.

Awesome place !
Had the "Black & Blue" Burger ... cooked just right !
The wife ordered a spinich salad, the bartender highly recommended it with the goat cheese ... she agreed, and could not have been happier.
Spent a while there afterwards sipping Fireball on the rocks (they keep it in the freezer!) 
An evening well spent !!
hard to find a good burger in the morning for early risers , but repetes came to the rescue killer burger thanks i,ll be back , ps good fries too

I have been meaning to check this place out for quite a while...I don't know what took me so long...
When I first walked in the bartender immediately greeted me and was very friendly and attentive. The bar wasn't very busy, but he was very outgoing and kept the vibe light and fun.
I ordered the turkey dinner... and it was very good. The turkey was very tender and I really like the mashed red potatoes and stuffing. The bartender talked me into trying the homemade cranberry sauce. I'm glad that I did, because it was really yummy. 

The bar is pretty spacious. I will definitely be back to try some other stuff.

I went to this bar a few months back.  Giving the ever cumbersome bar closures that are happening monthly in this town, here come s newly remodeled bar in an already existing location with a different name.  
     Completely revamped inside and out.  It's nice and clean and a decent size of everything you want.  The food is good and i'm not sure on prices but they may seem to be a bit high, but hey, the food is good and from what I can tell is mainly fresh.  Fresh, cheap ingredients=great food.  Just remember the overhead of the business and such.  
     I have yet to have a bad experience and or meal in this place.  I think I've found my new bar.  Thus driving past the other 5 that have food and beverage and gaming, so.... it begs the question?  What are they doing right and all the other doing wrong as for me going there to spend my hard earned money? :)
I always go there for breakfast. I am always pleased with the service and coffee. Perfect low key morning spot.

Las Vegas' best kept secret...wait...why i am i even telling you?  Just go.  Go enjoy the great beer on tap, the awesome food, and the excellent service.  But you didn't hear it from me.  

Get the turkey dinner, its like thanksgiving, but better!

Wow! Went for our date night and sat at the bar. The food was fresh and delicious! I had the raspberry martini which was sweet and fruity; which is right up my ally. Zucchini fries were fresh and perfectly cooked. We got the shrimp, goat cheese, dates, with bacon special. Yumm Then we ordered the Pete's sliders which were pretty good but not extraordinary. We also tried the wedge salad which was also pretty tasty. 

Finished it up with a brownie desert which was AMAZING! No over cooked sticky block of chocolate. It was cooked perfectly. Crispy crust with moist inside was heaven.

Needless to say we will be repete customers.  :)

Exceptional bar food and a wide variety of other options to surprise you as well.  The hand dipped onion rings will really surprise you.  They are massive and very tasty. As an entree, I ordered the Tilapia Picata with steamed veggies and homemade mashed potatoes and was blown away at the portions size, flavor and presentation for $13.  The flavors reminded me of a fine dining option, except the fish of choice.  Our server was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu, providing great recommendations.  

Location: very close to the airport, I'd recommend it for a quick stop in when travelling.  The only downside is that smoking is allowed inside (not allowed in Tennessee).
Wow. Came here on yelp suggestion. Wedge salad was awesome!  Chicken cordon blue delicious. The beef tips au poivre were tender and heavenly. Server was attentive and helpful. Great experience!

RePete's is one of my favorite dive bars with great food. Some of their choices are spot on, some are a little bit of a miss, but they have a great variety for a bar.

I've tried the steak tips, pizzas, carbonara, wings, burgers, as well as a few sandwiches and wraps. Of my favorites are the steak tips and carbonara, while the wings were a great value during happy hour but average overall.

The staff here is pretty friendly, though one time we wanted to have the volume turned up on an NBA finals game and they said the locals wanted to listen to the random background music over the game, which was kind of sad considering they have great TVs and it looks like it should be friendly for sports. I understand the fact that regulars have a higher priority but it seemed ridiculous considering how much it looks like a sports bar.

Still, I do like to come back here, particularly for the excellent carbonara.

The sun is shining and the top is down, it's another perfect day in Las Vegas. Its days like this when you can easily find yourself lost in the splendor, and sometimes - well just plain lost. 

Such was the case the other day when I found myself pulling into a place called RePete's. After all, how in the world are you ever supposed to find this place unless you're lost? All kidding aside, RePete's is the reimagined local joint off the 15 that suffered from being on a road to nowhere, that is until they finally finished the Warm Springs bridge over the interstate last year. Still, it's hard to imagine many people find themselves driving by this place in their day-to-day lives (maybe I'm wrong), which is too bad really because RePete's has some rather delicious food and a very comfortable environment.

During my most recent visit, I was moved to try the Cuban sandwich with sweet potato fries. First of all, any place that offers sweet potato fries is alright in my book, so the sandwich didn't need to accomplish much to win me over. To my surprise, the sandwich was very good; the pickles were crisp and tangy and the piles of meat did not disappoint.

So next time you find yourself getting lost in Las Vegas for no reason, lose yourself over to RePete's for a bite to eat, and some friendly banter with the barkeep.

This place is amazing. We were starved at 11 pm and we saw this place. It looks a little bit divey from the outside with the 24 hour signs and the flat screens  but don't let that fool you.  The food tasted so fabulous. Our group of 3 had gourmet salad s and crab cakes, nachos and salads.  They have a lot of greek items on the menu as well.   This place was a life saver and was easy to get to because it was off of the street.  Reasonably priced for the quality.
Good food, nice atmosphere and friendly setvice.  Bartender was a little overworked but I would go back.

Scenery: It's very modern inside. The seats and tables are all black. It almost looks like it could be a club. It's simply but yet nice. 
 
Food: The food was really really great. I came here with my friend and I was actually shocked at how good the food was. The wings are not the tiny size that you get everywhere else. It's a good helping. The French fries taste so fresh and the cut is great! I even tried some of my friends nachos and the cheese wasn't the cheap nasty cheese I've had at some places. It's not to thin or thick. It taste like yummy melty deliciousness. Don't get me started on dessert. Banana Foster? Just try it. If you like cheesecake, bananas, and ice cream...Banana Foster. 

The late night guy had a really great personality and was really attentive and awake! (We came in around 3am) 

Overall: It's a great place. Definitely my go-to late night bite place.
The Monte Cristo they advertise on their menu isn't a real Monte Cristo.  They don't even jelly or jam with the sandwich.

We ended up here quite by accident after our first couple of choices were closed for Thanksgiving. We lucked out because this place is a really cool place to hang and enjoy a cold one or two and watch a game. The place was mostly empty because it was a holiday, but apparently they ordinarily do a pretty good business. We only drank and did not eat, but the beers tasted super fresh. The service was very friendly and before we were in an extended conversation. The main drawback is that it located a ways from the action on the strip, but if you feel like regaining your sanity and getting off the strip, I would recommend heading here.

This place is a pretty great restaurant disguised as a bar!  The amount of food you get is out of control! I went there with 4 others for dinner and each of us brought home leftovers.  My husband and God-mother had the chicken cordon bleu with red skinned whipped potatoes and this thing made all our jaws drop when the plates were brought  - huge!  It was 2 chicken breasts flattened slightly with a light breading on them with one on top of the other. In between was thin ham slices and Swiss cheese, all covered with some amazing looking sauce.  It wasn't rolled up like you usually find cordon bleu, it's their own spin on, and both of them loved it but took half of it home.  My God-pop had beef tips, with the same whipped potatoes and said they were good, my sister had one of the specials, chicken and sausage with bean stew and there was a lot of it, really thick, and she loved it too. Me I had the cod florentine, which was a couple good planks of great cod with some spinach in a lemony wine sauce, awesome!  The prices are such that one came come here and not feel robbed like a lot places are doing nowadays.  My cod dinner with whipped potatoes and veggies was $13.50, it would have easily been $5 more at least, elsewhere and I probably wouldn't have gotten due to that...perfect price and great food...we will be back!

Thank you Yelp!  I found this place just 1 mile from the Oasis RV Resort.  When we drove up to it, it looked like any other 24 hour Vegas bars.  My Husband was immediately turned off, and wanted to turn tail and run.  I assured him that Yelp sent me here and it would be ok.

Upon entering there is a door to the right that says 21 years old.  That is the bar side, and since my daughter is  not 21 for 6 more long agonizing hours, and we don't care for smoke, we chose the door on the left!  The dining room was smoke free, beautifully decorated with hard wood flooring, dark stained wood tables, nice placemats, and candles.   I really liked their high quality cloth napkins.  It is such a small thing, but so often overlooked. 

Now let's get to the reason were here- the food.  In one word AMAZING!  They were offering 4 specials that came with soup or salad, entree and dessert.  My salad was deliciously crisp, with a nice tangy blue cheese dressing.  I really liked that they didn't overdress the salad.  My husband had the same and also liked his salad.   The entree choices were : Chicken Picante, Pork Chops au Poivre, Beef  Tips Stroganoff over egg noodles, and  Tilapia Piccata. 

I had the pork chops, and let me tell you, those were the best pork chops I have ever had in a restaurant.   The sauce was mind blowing!  It was filled with green peppercorns, demi-glacé, brandy, and finished with cream.  It was served with fresh sautéed vegetables, and creamy mashed potatoes.

My husband also couldn't say enough good things about his chicken picante.  It was boneless skinless chicken breasts topped with a mushroom, white wine and cream sauce, also served with veggies and potatoes.

My daughter ordered grilled salmon, with the same sautéed veggies (a nice mix of squash, carrots, onions, broccoli), and potatoes. She was a member of the clean plate club, and  said she would gladly order that again. 

Now here is where things get really exciting! RePete's is a family owned business.  This family happens to be Greek.  Dessert was included in our meal, otherwise we wouldn't have ordered it.  Our server brought out for us this incredible Greek pastry.  It had a flaky phillo dough crust, with a creamy custard topping that reminded me of creme brûlée.  Angels sang at first bite of this pastry.  Between the three of us, this 4"x6" piece of perfection was gone in a flash.  This praise coming from someone that rarely eats dessert.  Take it from me....order this! 

The best part of all, I didn't mention, this incredible meal was only $15.99 per person!

The service was impeccable, and they saw to our every want and need.  I can't wait to eat here again on our way home from vacation.

I am not a fan of bar food so when I was told we are going here I was not a happy camper........BUT RePete's is fantastic!  IT's hardly bar food and if you want to call it bar food then I would say its gourmet!  I called in the order for pickup and they had everything ready and correct when I came to get it!  I have been here twice now and I have ordered the veggie salad which was AMAZING!!!!!!  Lots of steamed veggies and of course the goat cheese which is my favorite!  
The second time I ate here I ordered the veggie omelet and it was HUGE!!!!!!  But I ate the entire thing. 
I recommend coming to this place if you want to have good food and drinks!

The place was nice and clean for a bar. We ordered the Greek meatballs, the shrimp scampi- Athens style starter and the spinach chicken salad. 

Greek meatballs were mediocre and I wouldn't order it again. The fries were not good either.

The shrimp scampi were five huge shrimps and were really tasty.

The spinach chicken salad was really flavorful and a good portion.

I've heard some good things about this spot for awhile now. So glad I finally checked it out. Black and bleu sliders were incredible. My brother had the beef tips which were equally amazing. Perfectly marinated and super tender. We were considering going back for dinner, yes, it's that good. 

This is one of those places where you want to be a regular. I think I'm heading in that direction.
Food is awesome but even if you're playing, they charge you for drinks.  There are plenty of places where you can drink for free if you're playing.

Fiance and I had a completely unexpected, amazing (first time) experience here. 

Decided to finally give this place a shot as we had always seen it as we drove down the blvd- what better time then after a random 3-day strip adventure (that involved some *cough* minor drinking *cough* festivities)...

We were in the mood for some good ol' bar food and couldn't have asked for a better experience...

Walked in on a Saturday afternoon and there was only about 6 other people in the entire place, decided to sit at the bar where we were pleasantly greeted by our server. She was a sweet-heart!

Then, the unexpected happened, an older gentleman sitting at the end of the bar came over to greet us:

 "I just had to come over and say thank you for coming in, and that you two are the best looking couple I have ever had in my bar" 

The owner, Mr. Pete himself, came over to say hello, and well, I must say he was the classiest older gentleman I've talked to in quite some time! Went out of his way to come say hello and complement us...


We sent a drink over for him to say thanks :)

He then had (the BEST) Creme Brulee Sent over to us at the end of our meal...

Had to say, it was the best Creme Brulee i've eaten in quite some time- perhaps it was the influence from his complement ;) but it really was fantastic- creamy, not too sweet, you could tell it was home-made (even had the fresh vanilla beans).


It was happy hour, so we then decided to give a few a things a shot, Including beer and wine (much needed ;) 

Quesadilla 
Spicy Chicken Tenders with Fries
Greek salad

...Everything was delicious (and so cheap for HH prices) Not greasy either...


And like I said- The Creme Brulee- To die for! (you wouldn't expect this from a small bar off the blvd)...Can't wait to try their actual dinners here. They have quite the extensive menu.


I am so happy we took the time to try this place out. Awesome experience.


We will most definitely be returning very soon- can't believe this place is right around the corner- sorry but no other bar around the area compares for food, prices, cleanliness, atmosphere and experience. 

If you're looking for a laid back place off the strip to grab a drink and some (hangover) grub, definitely stop by and say Hello to Pete if you have the chance ;) You won't regret it! We would come back just to sit down and talk with him again...

Perfect ending to our weekend.

My business associates and I attend tradeshows twice a year in Vegas. We choose not to stay on the strip and deal with the crowds, the high cost of food,  and gambling temptations. 

Several trips ago, we began hanging out at RePete's. We love their convenient location and comfortable environment.

RePete's has very friendly servers and the owners are very welcoming. The food is very good and drink prices are more than fair.

RePete's has a nice selection of beer on tap. Not like the Yard House, but enough to satisfy the beer snobs.

We will be back in July at our next convention for sure!

This place is a huge ray of sunshine compared to the business that used to be here before, which was Screwballs.  From being an old, dark, univiting bar/restaurant, this place has come a long way.

I typically come here during the week because its conveniently located near where I work and the staff are always friendly.  They have separated the bar from the restaurant to cater to people who don't want to have to deal with the loud bunch.  Very smart and appealing for the locals.  On top of this, the food is great and so is the selections.  I come here at least once a week or so.

Randomly came across this place last night, and I was impressed. Our bartender's name was Caleb and he was awesome. The food and beer was also amazing. The inside is super clean and have a good amount of tvs to watch the games on. We went on Wednesday at midnight for the happy hour. 1/2 of appetizers and pizzas and cheap beer. Can't go wrong!

Came with a company function; I think there were about 18 of us during a Friday night Happy Hour.  Food is better-than-average bar food; I really liked the fries.  Unfortunately, for a group our size (full of heavy drinkers I might add) one cocktail server was not adequate.  Ours was friendly and kept her smile up despite the fact that we were pretty demanding, but she simply couldn't keep up with our orders.  I can't see myself coming back here on my own because the atmosphere isn't anything to write home about, but I'll definitely look forward to a return engagement for a work event because the food was quite yummy.

Enjoyable dinner.  It was pretty quiet.  I do like that they have the dinning separated from the bar area. The atmosphere was very relaxing and comfortable.  It was clean and very nice, definitely not what you would expect when you drive up. 

Our waitress was very attentive. She was never far away and did keep our glasses full. 

The meal was very tasty.  We had the Tips and they were very good. I'm not a huge fan of fries, so I opted for the Lyonnaise Potatoes when were tasty but perhaps a little too mushy for my personal taste. The flavor was good.  

We may not be a frequent visitor but I'm sure we will return.

Came here to get a cocktail & food. Nobody minds their business here, the customer service is very blah. For a not full bar it took forever to be checked on. REPETES? I will not be a "REPETE" customer!!
Stopped in for lunch, the food was awesome as always! My wife had the chicken tacos and I had the chicken strips. Yum! It was fast and delicious, an easy stop if you are on a lunch break.

Our 8th or 9th time here and the food is consistently very good. My most recent visit I had the Shrimp Scampi Athens style, was outstanding. Wifey had the Pizza with White Sauce and it was great too. Service could be faster, but hey it's a bar. You can't go wrong here, lots of T V's, comfortable seats and great food.

stopped in for some breakfast. the corned beef was straight out of the can Hormel. the wife's "applewoood" smoked bacon was just regular cheap bacon. the rye toast was good and the coffee was hot and tasty. there was a weird mix of death metal and 80s pop on the stereo. service was friendly though. maybe they are working on their breakfast selection or something but from my experience I wouldn't make a point of returning.

Recently moved to the Silverado Ranch area and wanted to try something new. Saw this place had some good reviews and decided to give it a try. Best idea we had. The employees were super friendly, which set the tone for the bar. I had the steak pita sandwhich..........DELICIOUS. I was very impressed with how clean the bar looked, including the bathroom :-). I've already invited friends to go in the future. Definitely a place to hangout and eat and drink regularily. I can't wait to try other items on the menu!!
Best burger in town.  We are going to miss you Pete.  Repete's close on the 29th and it will become Home Plate.

From the dining to the video machines and drinks we always feel how luxurious it is going here. Not your normal "bar food" and they really are competitive in prices. They have things like Guinness and Wasatch on draft which is unlike most late-night dine-in bars. Cannot rave enough about bartender and server Maria. She really keeps us coming back. And is always so joyful to be around. Her & Josh know the menu front to back and are very fast. I only put 4 stars "Yay! I'm a fan" because I am - however I would have rated this establishment 5 stars if it wasn't for the uptight rude and non-attentive bartender JC (I believe his name is).  So now when we go we look for our favorites, MARIA & JOSH. :-D They always make our experience so great. Ask for the daily special menu - there's some nice surprises on there and they do serve awesome dessert (which is not on the menu, why I do not know). Cheers!

After a nice Saturday morning workout, I decided to meet my buddy for breakfast.  My buddy loves the beer, ladies, and the gambling, so it was NO surprise that he suggested this place for a quick bite.  I quickly yelped the place, saw it was a "bar." but received great reviews, and decided I'd tweak the menu to make my meal somewhat healthy.  I arrived before my friend and sat at the bar as I know his crazy ass will probably stick a "hundo" in the machine as we chit chat and catch up.  

As soon as I sit down, the owner, Pete (of course that's his name) comes over and says he is so happy to see a pretty young woman at his bar, I've made his day and to enjoy the food.  Pete is the nicest, sweetest, man ever.  He's completely renovated the place (used to be a shit hole, my friend's exact words). REBEL gear everywhere!  Anyway, my buddy orders the $5 ham and eggs and I grab the veggie omelet.  Food is fantastic!  Even the coffee was good, so that tells you a lot about a place.  It really was a great meal and service was fast and friendly. My friend hangs out here all the time and raved about RePete's wings, burgers, and beef tips too. 

After a great meal and hysterical conversation, Pete comes back, asks how our food was. He's so excited now because my friend and I have come in and now 3 young guys (after a round of golf) come in to grub as well. I promise him to tell all you yelpers and facebookers about his place.  I'll definitely be setting up a HH here for my friends very soon!!  Its the perfect place to catch a  football game (GO COWBOYS!!). Come say hello to Pete and support a local business!!

This place is truly a gem!! My daughter and I were visiting Vegas, I saw the reviews, and decided to give it a try. We were definitely not disappointed! I had the beef tips - they were melt-in-your-mouth delicious!! My daughter had the top sirloin - also really good. I also had two Lemon Drops made perfectly! 

What really made this restaurant over-the-top was the price for our meal (under $50?? - REALLY??) and also the woman (Pete's wife I believe) who came to our table to personally deliver a special butter sauce she had the chef make up for my daughter who has dairy allergies. 

Thank you RePete's for the delicious dinner, wonderful service, and outstanding customer service!! My next question is....When are you coming to Seattle?!?
Ummmmm ok so indifferent bartender. .. ok... I can deal with that but I won't be back. We just stopped in and we were 2 of 4 people total in the place. We were treated like we were not welcome.

Needed breakfast after a crack-of-dawn flight. RePete's is only a few blocks from the airport. This 24 hour sports bar is pure Vegas--low lights, black vinyl, mini Xmas lights throughout. Our omelettes with home fries were excellent, and the coffee was fine. Ice water with a lemon slice--nice touch. Just what we wanted before a 2 hour drive into the desert. Many choices for breakfast--steak and eggs, biscuits and gravy, french toast, and breakfast burrito. Will return.
Great meal! Real Food very well prepared and presented! Waitress was very friendly and informative.  We checked Yelp for the reviews and when the locals eat there you can be assured it will be good!
Great food & drinks, great prices, service was awesome. Hubby had the beef tips and I had the chicken piccata. Our kids (3 & 6) shared the cheese pizza and we all shared the wedge salad, phenomenal.
Not a bad place to grab food after a long night. Usually I'll grab a drink here and the service is good people are friendly

I would rather sit on the runway in a plane full of eboli ridden, obese and obnoxious Canadians then have to work in service industry on night like tonight.....ALll Hallows Eve.....Good job and made us feel special.. We enjoyed it....
The food is really good and the service is swift and friendly.  A wonderful surprise at the south end of the Vegas strip.

I frequent RePete's for lunch as I work close by. So this will only be about lunch fare. Don't drink here and not a big gambler (make the machines so no allure). 

Food here is good American pub style food. Burgers and sandwiches are all pretty standard. I really like the salads when I'm looking for lighter fare. The diner entrees have a lot of food when I'm on the hungry side. 

For lunch RePete's is nice. I go with vendors often. I like the Yelp coupon and it throws sales people when you get them some discount. The atmosphere and remodel (3ish years ago) make the place nice for business lunches. But not so elegant that you stay away for casual lunches. 

I've watched sports here as well. World Cup (soccer) and Olympics. Find the amount of TVs and placement well suited for watching.

I'm new in town, having finally made the decision to get the hell out of the People's Republic of Berkeley and the hideous domestic entanglement that virtually imprisoned me there for almost 20 years.  The day after I parked the U-haul at 3 AM, my best friend Eddie and I headed to RePete's for some necessary fuel and libations.  Linda, the smart and attractive bartender, hooked us right up w/ cold beers and some excellent food.  I believe I had the turkey sandwich, which was just right - fresh-tasting and not so heavy that I felt like taking a nap afterward.  

And, as I always want to do after a satisfying, I had a smoke.  But, unlike in the Bay Area, where it's illegal to smoke within 20 FEET of a doorway, I was able to sit and enjoy my smoke and another cold one in the comfort of the bar.

Since then, I've been back a few times.  For Sunday Brunch, breakfasts are delicious, and the Bloodies are tasty.  All the food is made fresh and with care.  In the evening, when cocktails are warranted; they know how to make them right.  The best part is:  RePete's is just a mile and a quarter from my house, so it's now my local, without a doubt.

My boyfriend & I just moved here from California, got in to our new home at around 2 am. I was looking for GOOD food open in the middle of the night. I found RePetes on line & the reviews made me willing to make the 30 min round trip to get food from there. I ordered my boyfriend a breakfast burrito, which on the menu there was NO mention of it including onions which my boyfriend is allergic to. When I got home my boyfriend opened his burrito to find it FILLED with onions. I called RePetes & spoke with Josh, who has originally taken my order. He apologized profusely & offered to remake it for free if I came back. I was so tired I didn't want to waste another 30 minutes driving around, so I asked for a refund that I would come in for later. Josh said he'd have to get the refund approved by his manager & if for any reason it wasn't approved, he said he would refund me out of his own tips. A few days later I went back in, ordering another breakfast burrito, assuming that it would be comped. When I arrived Josh recognized me right away. He started to tell me that he asked the chef & he said he never put onions in my burrito & they don't even come on it.... Basically like I'm an idiot & don't know what an onion looks/smells like, and he argued with me for about 5 minutes over whether or not the onions were actually in there or not! Then he tells me "the chefs human to, we all make mistakes" Really!?!? & then when I asked if I could get the burrito comped, he tells me he can't because he wasn't the one who took my order. But to make up for it he offered my underaged friend and I shots to make up for it. Needless to say I won't be returning to RePetes.

We were pleasantly surprised with this local find. They offered creative menu choices and the food measured up to our expectations. So did the drinks. Stephani, our wait staff, was very attentive. We were very happy with the ambiance, the food, and the drinks! Thanks for making our first night in Vegas fabulous!

While I still think RePete's is awesome for food and drinks, my breakfast experience here was disappointing. I came in on a Sunday morning and got a bloody mary. My friend ordered a mimosa. The food was okay, but OMG the bloody marys and the mimosas were disgusting. My friend's mimosa was so flat and she told me that she saw the bartender poor from on already opened bottle. Being that it was 9am and we were the only people in the bar, the bottle was probably from the night or day before. When we told her about the flat mimosa, her response was, "Oh, I THOUGHT it smelled kinda skunky." I mean, REALLY!???? Why THE F*$# would you serve it to a customer if you thought it "smelled kinda skunky"?!? My friend was pissed and said to just take off the bill because she was grossed out.  My bloody mary was basically cheap vodka mixed with tomato juice and tabasco. It was so gross. I felt bad for dragging my friend here for breakfast to a place I promised her would be awesome. The skunky mimosa and bartender's comment is just inexcusable and a reason I will probably never return to RePete's.

Great location! Very nice staff. Chill place to watch your college football... and don't forget to eat some of their Pete's Sliders (which includes their homemade potato chips) and drink a Naked Freixenet Mimosa! Only things missing are a juke box and a pool table (or 2).
Great food and service!!! Breakfast omelet was the bomb! Loved the hospitality!!! Thank you for a great experience Elisha!
Really good place to eat. Food is great at an ok price and you don't have to smell the smoke from the bar. Service is always really good.

Could have been 5 stars... easy!  But service was slow probably due to the fact that's it the Fourth of July and only one person was working the dining room at breakfast (10:30am).

But still.... OUTSTANDING!  Really.

We're renting a house and are from out of town over the 4th weekend and are only eating at restaurants we cannot eat at where we live.  I found this restaurant on Yelp, read all the reviews and looked at every photo, and convinced the wife we should try it out.

Two warning signs I'm glad we didn't pay any attention to.  First, Open 24/7 was one red flag.  Second was the bar-side casino.  Ignore those!  When you walk in the front door you have two options; go right into the bar side which has smoking and gambling, or go left into the non-smoking dining room.  We chose to go left as I was with 2 children.

The dining room side seats about 40 people total, is warm yet modern feeling with nice tables and chairs.  We sat in the chairs a while and never got uncomfortable.  Plus, everything is new and sturdy... no wobbly tables needing a sugar packet under one leg.

There are TV sets on in the dining room with the sound off.  The Muzak is piped in but very soft.  Just about perfect.  Mostly it played 70's popular music (Boston, etc...).  Easy to tune out or listen to if you like the song.  You can also see through the glass window separating the bar and dining room if you're not facing the TV sets and can view 4 others that way if a sporting event is on that you're interested in watching.

Our waitress Edna was awesome.  She just needed a little help.  Or maybe we showed up along with everyone else around the same time.  No big deal... we put on our patience caps and just enjoyed the music.  Edna was exceptionally friendly and seemed to know everything about the menu as well as the chef and owners.  She did a great job of filling us in.

The food!  Well, it was 10:30am and we weren't interested in Breakfast so I asked if we could look at the lunch/dinner menu.  No problem!  I also had a beer.  Don't judge we're on vacation.

I had the Greek Meatball appetizer with fries and I believe tzatziki sauce (it was white and good).  We also ordered the House Special Beef Tips, Chicken Parm and Chicken Piccata.  The food was 5-Star all the way.  I'm serious.  Our dinner the night before on the strip at a steakhouse was $400 for four and this food was better.  We were all quite shocked at the quality this early in the morning when they're cooking breakfast for most people.  I read the reviews and knew it was going to be good, but I didn't expect it to be THIS good!

The fries are crazy good and every meal came out piping HOT.  The chicken piccata was cooked perfectly, was as moist as chicken can get, and the sauce with capers was incredible.  The Greek meatballs are great, as was the Chicken Parm (with penne noodles).  The steak on the House Special Beef tips is so tender and good I can't believe they don't charge more for the meal.  You can get a sauce on the side with this meal also for dipping which is really good, but not needed at all.  The steak flavor and tenderness was better than the $60 Tomahawk Ribeye I had the night before.

Everyone wants to go back.  Our rule on vacation is never eat at the same place twice but we may break that rule.  Plus if the service is better I can upgrade this to a 5 star review which it was this place deserves.

OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!!!

They have Devastator beer on tap!  ohhhhh yea!   And the fish sandwich is off the chain!  This is my first time here, but my husband has been here a couple of times.   I got the nachos, because I love nachos. There's need a little kick, like some jalapenos!  Chips were fresh, it just missed the extra kick!   Now the fish sandwich.....OMG  was amazing!  Ohhhh I will be back!  It was on a ciabatta bun!  and it had coleslaw and cheese, with the tarter sauce on the side!  oohhhhhhhh, and the fried zucchini  was really good!  With a yelp check in you get 15% off.  The barternders were very attentive.   I like this place!

My friend and I had just come from Mandalay and spent an hour at "Citizens" thinking we were going to have a great dinner....not...  We left and drove to Repetes and it was the best!  Super friendly waiter, our drinks were brought immediately and because of the bad experience at the previous venue I timed how long it took to get our food... Less than 10 minutes!  I had the sliders with the best and piping hot French fries and my friend ordered clicked strips, granted they were appetizers and it was 2am but we were hungry !  This little place made up for it!  I will come back again and see what other dish I order :)

Finger-licking good! The food is great! It's the your traditional food with a  modern twist. Burgers are made by the best beef out there. You will be blown away with everything on the menu. My hubs always has the chicken wings. Those come standard no funny-ness there. Wings are wings and they know how to make them right!
